name: Other Restricted Goods and Services
description: To encourage safety and deter potentially harmful activities, we prohibit attempts by individuals, manufacturers, and retailers to purchase, sell, raffle, gift, transfer or trade certain goods and services on our platform. We allow debate or advocacy for changes to regulations of goods and services covered in this policy.

categories.name: Endangered and Protected Species
categories.description: Content related to poaching, buying, selling, or trading of endangered species and their parts

subcategories.name: Buy/Sell/Trade Endangered Species
subcategories.description: Attempting to buy, sell, trade, donate, gift, ask for, coordinate, promote or encourage poaching of endangered species and their parts

subcategories.name: Instructions for Endangered Products
subcategories.description: Providing instructions on how to use or make products from endangered species or their parts

subcategories.name: Admission of Poaching
subcategories.description: Admitting to poaching, buying or trading endangered species by poster or their associates

subcategories.name: Coordinating/Threatening/Supporting Poaching
subcategories.description: Content coordinating, threatening, or supporting poaching of endangered species
examples: Let's organize a hunt for rhinos
I support poaching as a livelihood

subcategories.name: Depiction of Poaching Without Context
subcategories.description: Depicting poaching or endangered species byproducts with no other context
examples: Photo of ivory with no caption
Image of rhino horn with location tag only

subcategories.name: Endangered Species in Non-Sanctioned Environment
subcategories.description: Endangered species depicted in non-natural, non-sanctioned contexts
examples: Exotic animal kept as pet inside private home
Endangered bird in cage at someone's house

subcategories.name: Fictional/Documentary/Advocacy Context
subcategories.description: Endangered species content in fictional, documentary, or advocacy context
conditions: Fictional OR documentary OR advocacy context

categories.name: Non-Endangered Animals
categories.description: Sales, trades, adoptions, and products from non-endangered animals

subcategories.name: Peer-to-Peer Animal Sales
subcategories.description: Individual selling live non-endangered animals directly to another individual
examples: Kittens available, pickup at my house

subcategories.name: Animal Sale for Religious Offering
subcategories.description: Selling animals for religious sacrifice or offering purposes
examples: Doves for sale for religious festival

subcategories.name: Livestock Sale
subcategories.description: Attempting to buy, sell, or trade livestock
conditions: Livestock (cattle, pigs, chickens, goats, sheep, horses, ducks, buffaloes)

subcategories.name: Brick-and-Mortar Animal Sales
subcategories.description: Animal sales by legitimate businesses, breeders, or shelters
conditions: Legitimate brick-and-mortar entity OR breeder OR shelter

subcategories.name: Lost Pet Reward
subcategories.description: Offering reward for lost pets
examples: Help find my cat, reward offered

subcategories.name: Animal Adoption/Rehoming
subcategories.description: Adopting, donating, rehoming, gifting, or asking for live non-endangered animals including rehoming fees

subcategories.name: Animal Parts and Products
subcategories.description: Buying, selling, or trading animal teeth, horns, organs, limbs, carcasses, taxidermy, feces, or dog/cat products
conditions: Animal parts (teeth, horns, organs, limbs, carcasses, taxidermy, feces)

subcategories.name: Raw Animal Products for Consumption
subcategories.description: Raw meat, fish, eggs, or unpasteurized dairy intended for human consumption

categories.name: Historic Artifacts
categories.description: Archaeological discoveries, antiquities, mummified remains, ancient manuscripts

subcategories.name: Buy/Sell/Trade Historic Artifacts
subcategories.description: Attempting to buy, sell, trade, donate, gift or ask for historic artifacts
conditions: Historic artifact (archaeological, antiquity, mummy, ancient manuscript)

categories.name: Hazardous Goods and Materials
categories.description: Industrial grade poisons, chemicals, radioactive materials, and other hazardous substances

subcategories.name: Explosives in Weapons Context
subcategories.description: Explosive substances used in weapons context

subcategories.name: Hazardous Materials - General
subcategories.description: Industrial grade poisons, chemicals, corrosives, flammables, radioactive materials

categories.name: Human Body Parts and Bodily Fluids
categories.description: Human organs, body parts, blood, and other bodily fluids

subcategories.name: Depiction of Human Waste/Fluids Without Sale
subcategories.description: Depicting human waste and bodily fluids without sales context
examples: Image of blood without sale context

subcategories.name: Non-Regenerative Organ Trafficking
subcategories.description: Buying, selling, or trading non-regenerative organs (excluding legitimate donation/transplant)

subcategories.name: Other Body Parts
subcategories.description: Buying, selling, trading body parts other than non-regenerative organs
conditions: Body parts (excluding non-regenerative organs, hair products/wigs)

subcategories.name: Fluid Donation
subcategories.description: Donations of human fluids such as semen or blood plasma

subcategories.name: Fluid Exchange or Sale
subcategories.description: Exchange or sale of human fluids

categories.name: Sales in Fictional Context
categories.description: Fictional or documentary depictions of restricted goods sales

subcategories.name: Fictional Body Parts/Fluids
subcategories.description: Fictional depictions of buying/selling body parts or fluids
examples: TV show about black market body parts

subcategories.name: Fictional Historic Artifacts
subcategories.description: Fictional depictions of artifact trade

subcategories.name: Fictional Hazardous Materials
subcategories.description: Fictional depictions of hazardous materials trade

labelHierarchy.label: ORGS > Endangered Species > Admission or Depiction of Poaching
ORGS > Non-Endangered Animals > Brick-and-Mortar Sales
path: Brick and Mortar Live Non-Endangered Animals

exceptions.name: Fictional/Documentary/Advocacy Context
exceptions.description: Content in movies, TV shows, documentaries, cartoons, video games, comic books, music videos, or advocacy campaigns

exceptions.name: Endangered Animals in Sanctioned Environments
exceptions.description: Zoos, sanctuaries, circus, natural habitat, or animals accidentally inside home (not kept as pet)

exceptions.name: Lost Pet Rewards
exceptions.description: Offering rewards for finding lost pets

exceptions.name: Processed Meat/Fish
exceptions.description: Smoked, salted, cured, dried, canned meat/fish (salami, jerky, prosciutto, etc.)

exceptions.name: Pet Food and Supplies
exceptions.description: Pet food (not live animals), pet supplies, and processed animal byproducts

exceptions.name: Human Fluid Donation
exceptions.description: Blood, plasma, or semen donations in legitimate donation context

exceptions.name: Human Hair Products
exceptions.description: Extensions, wigs, and other hair products made from human hair

exceptions.name: Replica Artifacts
exceptions.description: Replicas of ancient objects, or items created after 1500 AD

exceptions.name: Modern Memorabilia
exceptions.description: Items from modern retail or memorabilia stores, even if characterized as old

exceptions.name: Non-Industrial Hazardous Materials
exceptions.description: Consumer-grade products: bug sprays, pest control services, manure fertilizer, pink Himalayan salt, cured meat with nitrites, asbestos property mentions

exceptions.name: Awareness/Condemnation
exceptions.description: Content raising awareness or condemning the sale of restricted items

exceptions.name: Depiction Without Sale Signals
exceptions.description: Depiction of historic artifacts without any buy/sell/trade signals

always_protected: Primates (bonobos, chimpanzees, gorillas, monkeys, orangutans, slow loris)
Bears (Asiatic black bears, giant pandas, sloth bears, sun bears)
Otters (European river otters, giant otters, California sea otters)
Wild cats (cheetahs, jaguars, leopards, lions, ocelots, tigers)
Sharks (great white, basking, whale sharks, smalltooth sawfish)
Birds (African grey parrots, falcons, eagles, helmeted hornbills)
Reptiles (ploughshare tortoises, Iranian spotted newt, Indian rock pythons, endangered iguanas)

glossary.poaching: The illegal trafficking and killing of wildlife animals
glossary.endangered_species: Type of organism threatened by extinction, listed in CITES Appendix I
glossary.historic_artifacts: Rare items of significant historical, cultural or scientific value: archaeological discoveries, antiquities, mummified remains, ancient scrolls/manuscripts
glossary.antiquities: Items from ancient civilizations (Middle East, North Africa, Turkey, Mediterranean, Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia)
glossary.ancient: Items before year 1500 or with explicit reference to being ancient or connected to past civilizations. Does NOT include replicas or items from modern retail
glossary.archaeological_discoveries: Items uncovered during excavations of historical sites - artifacts, human remains, documents, fossils
glossary.non_regenerative_organs: Organs that won't grow back: kidneys, livers, hearts, eyeballs, corneas, lungs, intestines, pancreases
glossary.human_fluids: Blood, urine, sweat, breast milk, sperm (also called 'baby in a bag' or 'raw children')
glossary.livestock: Domesticated animals raised in agriculture: buffaloes, cattle, chickens, ducks, horses, goats, pigs, sheep
glossary.raw_animal_products: Uncooked meat, fish, eggs, or unpasteurized dairy products
glossary.processed_meat: Smoked, salted, cured, dried, canned meat (salami, jerky, prosciutto, bacon, hot dogs, etc.)
glossary.sanctioned_environment: Natural habitat, zoos, sanctuaries, circus, or educational programs
glossary.non_sanctioned_environment: Private homes (as pets), dressed in human clothing, or other unnatural contexts
glossary.brick_and_mortar: Legitimate business with: professional website, physical location, business identification, verified status, or breeding license
glossary.peer_to_peer: Sale between unlicensed individuals, typically with personal pronouns, informal language, meetup locations
glossary.hazardous_materials: Industrial grade: toxic, corrosive, flammable, radioactive, or otherwise harmful to health/environment
glossary.fictional_content: Movies, TV shows, cartoons, video games, comic books, music videos, song lyrics
glossary.documentary: Non-fictional content to document reality for instruction, education, or historical record
glossary.promote: Speaking positively, encouraging use, providing instructions, or information on how to obtain
glossary.coordinate: Any attempt to organize flow of goods - recruiting dealers/drivers, ensuring transportation

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: Follow decision tree order for multiple violations
operationalGuidelines.intent_signals: For sale/FS, Looking to buy/LTB, Trade/Swap, Donate, Gift, Negotiable, Serious buyers only, Price listed, Contact info, DM me
operationalGuidelines.endangered_reference: Use CITES Appendix I for species identification
operationalGuidelines.ancient_threshold: Before year 1500 or 16th century. Use Google search to verify civilization dates
operationalGuidelines.industrial_grade: Products intended for industrial use, not consumer-grade items from grocery stores
operationalGuidelines.brick_mortar_signals: Business name/logo, physical storefront, professional tone, business contact info, breeding license
operationalGuidelines.peer_to_peer_signals: Personal pronouns (I, me, my), meetup locations, no business name, informal language
operationalGuidelines.code_circumvention: Depictions with no context, location tags only, hashtags only, banknote color codes for prices, 'nothing for sale' disclaimers with other sale indicators
operationalGuidelines.non_sanctioned_signals: Inside private home as pet, wearing human clothing, smoking, being held by humans without sanctuary context
